H0.text: a concave mirror can form a real image which is a copy of an object that forms. Upright

H1.text: a concave mirror can form a real image which is a copy of an object that forms. Magnified

H2.text: a concave mirror can form a real image which is a copy of an object that forms. Virtual

H3.text: a concave mirror can form a real image which is a copy of an object that forms. inverted

A4.text: If the 1/f term is larger than the 1/do term, then 1/di is positive and the image is real. Otherwise, the term is negative and the image is virtual.

A5.text: Real images can be produced by concave mirrors and converging lenses, only if the object is placed further away from the mirror/lens than the focal point, and this real image is inverted.

A6.text: As the object approaches the focal point the image approaches infinity, and when the object passes the focal point the image becomes virtual and is not inverted (upright image).
